<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/17/tiktok-tests-social-commerce?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
TikTok Is Growing Up so Fast
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="TikTok " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MDA4NjIxLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">TikTok, the video-focused social media app best known for vaulting teenagers wearing cups on their feet to internet fame, is testing online shopping in the U.S. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If successful, <a href="https://marketingland.com/tiktok-teases-social-commerce-capabilities-with-shoppable-video-test-271256?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the foray</a> into so-called “social commerce” could 1) diversify TikTok’s revenue beyond ads and 2) catapult TikTok onto the varsity lineup of social media apps.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The details: </strong>TikTok is letting a small sample of U.S. users (less than two dozen) <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tiktok-wades-into-online-shopping-11573854531?mod=business_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">add links</a> to their bios and the posts they share on the platform. Early examples appear to let users purchase products directly from the videos themselves, <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/15/20967028/tiktok-instagram-e-commerce-link-in-bio-monetization?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Verge reports</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“We’re always experimenting with new ways to improve the app experience,” a TikTok spokeswoman said.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They've done a pretty good job so far. The app has been downloaded by 100+ million Americans and over 1 billion globally—despite the U.S. government launching a <a href="https://www.lawfareblog.com/reflections-tiktok-and-data-privacy-national-security?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">national security investigation</a> into its Chinese parent company. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Social commerce is the gif that keeps on gifing</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Leading social media sites think the opportunity in e-commerce lies in streamlining the journey from discovery --> purchase.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Instagram lets users buy some items they see on their feeds without leaving the app. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Pinterest's Lens tool can </span><span><a href="https://marketingland.com/pinterest-brings-shoppable-pins-to-visual-searches-for-fashion-home-products-267420?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">identify</a></span><span> more than 2.5 billion fashion and home products. It'll then direct you to the retailer's website to check out.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Even Grandpa Snapchat launched shoppable ads last year. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Instagram may have made “link in bio” happen, but TikTok also has the <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/15/tiktok-link-bio-social-commerce/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">know-how</a>. Its Chinese owner ByteDance added a “Shop Now” feature to the Chinese version of TikTok last year...and one account did <a href="http://m.nbdpress.com/articles/2018-12-12/5795.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$29 million</a> in sales on last year's Singles Day alone. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If TikTok can make it easier for creators to monetize their audiences, you might see more jumping ship for Vine 2.0.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IPO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/17/saudi-aramco-ipo-details-underwhelm?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Aramco Needs a Lesson in Managing Expectations
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In an updated prospectus released yesterday, Saudi Arabia’s state-owned oil company Aramco said it expects to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/saudi-aramco-ipo-price-range-values-company-at-up-to-1-7-trillion-11573977968?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">list shares</a> at a valuation of $1.6 trillion to $1.7 trillion, short of the $2 trillion it had originally targeted.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The rest of the details are also underwhelming.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Aramco hopes to sell </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/17/saudi-aramco-ipo-set-to-value-company-up-to-1point7-trillion.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">1.5% of shares</a></span><span> on Saudi Arabia’s stock exchange, the Tadawul.  If the listing occurs at the lower end of the price range, the IPO would not top Alibaba’s when it raised $25 billion in 2014.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>To advertise the IPO, the company’s adopting a </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-17/aramco-seeks-1-71-trillion-valuation-in-world-s-biggest-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">farmers market attitude</a></span><span>. It’s focusing on local wealthy families and the country’s middle class, not international money managers.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What concerns investors?</strong> Questions of demand for oil and geopolitical risks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What excites investors?</strong> Strong cash flow and profits that make you drool. Aramco’s $68 billion profit in the first <span>nine</span> months of 2019 exceeded total 2018 profits for Apple, the <span>most profitable publicly traded company</span>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Aramco’s IPO is an essential piece of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s plan to shift the country’s economy away from purely energy.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CANNABIS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/17/cannabis-industry-picks-pieces-terrible-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Vibe Check: Legal Weed Industry
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="cannabis " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc0MDA2NzEwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Image by <a href="https://pixabay.com/users/NickyPe-10327513/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=4354389" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NickyPe</a> from <a href="https://pixabay.com/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=4354389" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pixabay</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The rush of bad cannabis industry headlines hit us like a brownie before meeting the inlaws.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Per <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-16/cannabis-flameout-rivals-dot-com-bust-as-legal-fears-curb-growth?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg</a>...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>After a brutal earnings report Thursday, the market cap of Canopy Growth, the world’s largest pot company, withered to C$7.1 billion (it was worth C$24 billion in April).</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>MedMen Enterprises, one of the first publicly traded U.S. weed companies, said Friday it’s dismissing 190 employees.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Aurora Cannabis (No. 2 largest public cannabis firm by sales) </span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/aurora-cannabis-stock-plunges-to-two-year-low-as-analysts-lose-faith-2019-11-15?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">logged</a></span><span> its worst trading day in 5+ years Friday after disappointing earnings.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why the bad vibes? </strong>Legalization in Canada and California was not the watershed moment many industry boosters promised. Complex regulations and high taxes have cramped growth, while illicit sellers and suburban high schoolers are proving to be tough competition. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/11/15/only-percent-americans-say-marijuana-should-be-completely-illegal/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mary Jane bulls</a> haven’t sworn off the drug yet. Cowen analyst and certified chiller Vivien Azer recently upped her U.S. sales outlook to $85 billion by 2030, and Canopy says it’ll turn a profit in 3–5 years.</p>

</h3>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know, the <em>you</em> you always dreamed of. The version of yourself that doesn’t have debilitating amounts of debt.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://go.commonbond.co/why-waste-money-every-month?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=refi-mktg-morningbrew-20191118&utm_content=morningbrew-20191118" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CommonBond</a> can help make you over by putting you on a path to financial freedom.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When it comes to student loans, people tend to use words like “frustrated,” “overwhelmed,” “stressed,” “angry,” “buried under it,” and “arghhhghghgh.” But with a CommonBond glow-up, here’s what people are <em>actually</em> saying:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“I will be able to pay off my student loan in a </span><span><strong style="color:#000">much more reasonable time period</strong></span><span> with a </span><span><strong style="color:#000">much better interest rate</strong></span><span>.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“My </span><span><strong style="color:#000">monthly payments decreased</strong></span><span> from $980 a month to $430. I finally feel </span><span><strong style="color:#000">more in control</strong></span><span> and as though a huge weight was lifted off my shoulders.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“I don't regret getting my graduate degree and having a student loan, but I feel so </span><span><strong style="color:#000">relieved at reducing the repayment period by 12 years</strong></span><span> and knowing that if I decide to retire at 63, I can do so without a student loan payment.” </span>
</li>
</ul>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tired of putting the team on their backs in <em>Madden</em>, professional athletes are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-17/nfl-and-mlb-players-team-up-to-start-jock-marketing-venture?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">taking steps</a> to make more money from the marketing and licensing of their names and images. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NFL and MLB players unions are teaming up with a private equity firm to create a company that’ll better leverage the value of athlete likenesses. The venture, called OneTeam Partners, will <span>initially focus</span> on video games...but also trading cards, esports, and youth academies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The context: </strong>Players are making <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nfl-mlb-players-tie-up-with-private-equity-to-boost-videogame-card-revenue-11573950424?mod=hp_lead_pos8&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more money than ever</a> from visual portrayals. Per data from the Labor Dept. cited by the WSJ... </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>NFL players earned about $200 million in marketing and licensing revenue in the year ended February. The union earned </span><span><span>nearly </span></span><span>$57 million alone from the </span><span><em>Madden </em></span><span>video game.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>MLB players made $61 million, up 13% annually. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>“After years of watching team owners find new revenue streams through divvying up rights, athletes are more aware of their own collective marketing power and are finding new ways to wield it,” the WSJ writes.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Housing starts; e-commerce retail sales; earnings (Home Depot, Urban Outfitters, TJX, Kohl’s) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Minutes from the last Fed meeting; Democratic presidential debate in Atlanta; earnings (Target, Lowe’s, Sonos)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Existing home sales; jobless claims; Elon Musk unveils Tesla’s electric pickup truck; deadline for government spending bill; earnings (Gap, Intuit, Macy’s, Nordstrom) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Kansas City Fed Manufacturing Index</p>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTikTok Is Growing Up so Fast\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"TikTok \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTikTok, the video-focused social media app best known for vaulting teenagers wearing cups on their feet to internet fame, is testing online shopping in the U.S. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf successful, \u003ca href=\"https://marketingland.com/tiktok-teases-social-commerce-capabilities-with-shoppable-video-test-271256?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe foray\u003c/a\u003e into so-called “social commerce” could 1) diversify TikTok’s revenue beyond ads and 2) catapult TikTok onto the varsity lineup of social media apps.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe details: \u003c/strong\u003eTikTok is letting a small sample of U.S. users (less than two dozen) \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/tiktok-wades-into-online-shopping-11573854531?mod=business_lead_pos6\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadd links\u003c/a\u003e to their bios and the posts they share on the platform. Early examples appear to let users purchase products directly from the videos themselves, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/15/20967028/tiktok-instagram-e-commerce-link-in-bio-monetization?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe Verge reports\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“We’re always experimenting with new ways to improve the app experience,” a TikTok spokeswoman said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey've done a pretty good job so far. The app has been downloaded by 100+ million Americans and over 1 billion globally—despite the U.S. government launching a \u003ca href=\"https://www.lawfareblog.com/reflections-tiktok-and-data-privacy-national-security?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enational security investigation\u003c/a\u003e into its Chinese parent company. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSocial commerce is the gif that keeps on gifing\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLeading social media sites think the opportunity in e-commerce lies in streamlining the journey from discovery --\u003e purchase.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eInstagram lets users buy some items they see on their feeds without leaving the app. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePinterest's Lens tool can \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://marketingland.com/pinterest-brings-shoppable-pins-to-visual-searches-for-fashion-home-products-267420?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eidentify\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e more than 2.5 billion fashion and home products. It'll then direct you to the retailer's website to check out.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEven Grandpa Snapchat launched shoppable ads last year. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eInstagram may have made “link in bio” happen, but TikTok also has the \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/11/15/tiktok-link-bio-social-commerce/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eknow-how\u003c/a\u003e. Its Chinese owner ByteDance added a “Shop Now” feature to the Chinese version of TikTok last year...and one account did \u003ca href=\"http://m.nbdpress.com/articles/2018-12-12/5795.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$29 million\u003c/a\u003e in sales on last year's Singles Day alone. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf TikTok can make it easier for creators to monetize their audiences, you might see more jumping ship for Vine style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn an updated prospectus released yesterday, Saudi Arabia’s state-owned oil company Aramco said it expects to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/saudi-aramco-ipo-price-range-values-company-at-up-to-1-7-trillion-11573977968?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elist shares\u003c/a\u003e at a valuation of $1.6 trillion to $1.7 trillion, short of the $2 trillion it had originally targeted.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe rest of the details are also underwhelming.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAramco hopes to sell \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/17/saudi-aramco-ipo-set-to-value-company-up-to-1point7-trillion.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e1.5% of shares\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on Saudi Arabia’s stock exchange, the Tadawul.  If the listing occurs at the lower end of the price range, the IPO would not top Alibaba’s when it raised $25 billion in 2014.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTo advertise the IPO, the company’s adopting a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-17/aramco-seeks-1-71-trillion-valuation-in-world-s-biggest-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efarmers market attitude\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. It’s focusing on local wealthy families and the country’s middle class, not international money managers.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat concerns investors?\u003c/strong\u003e Questions of demand for oil and geopolitical risks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat excites investors?\u003c/strong\u003e Strong cash flow and profits that make you drool. Aramco’s $68 billion profit in the first \u003cspan\u003enine\u003c/span\u003e months of 2019 exceeded total 2018 profits for Apple, the \u003cspan\u003emost profitable publicly traded company\u003c/span\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAramco’s IPO is The union earned \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003enearly \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$57 million alone from the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eMadden \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003evideo game.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMLB players made $61 million, up 13% annually. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp
